law.catch_line: Department may use money received from federal government.
law.text: The Department of Corrections may accept money from the federal government, or any of its agencies, under any grant agreement entered into by the State of Kentucky or the Department of Corrections. The money may be expended for capital outlay in accordance with the provisions of KRS 56.440 to 56.550.
law.history: Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 211, sec. 31, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 344, sec. 11, effective July 15, 1982. -- Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 74, Art. V, sec. 24(14). -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 50, sec. 30. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 216aa-25a.
